sourcing.instructions: K can be sourced from potassium chloride (KCl) at a chemical supplier. Nb can be obtained from niobium metal or niobium oxide from a metal supplier. Rb is available as rubidium chloride (RbCl) from a chemical supplier. Se can be obtained from selenium powder from a chemical supply company. V can be sourced from vanadium pentoxide (V2O5) from a chemical supplier.
steps: K can be sourced from potassium chloride (KCl) at a chemical supplier. Nb can be obtained from niobium metal or niobium oxide from a metal supplier. Rb is available as rubidium chloride (RbCl) from a chemical supplier. Se can be obtained from selenium powder from a chemical supply company. V can be sourced from vanadium pentoxide (V2O5) from a chemical supplier.

1. Measure out the exact amounts of all ingredients using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine K, Nb, Rb, Se, and V. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly grind the mixture until it reaches a fine, uniform powder. 4. Transfer the powdered mixture into a ceramic crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out the exact amounts of all ingredients using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine K, Nb, Rb, Se, and V. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly grind the mixture until it reaches a fine, uniform powder. 4. Transfer the powdered mixture into a ceramic crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 1000°C. 2. Place the ceramic crucible with the powdered mixture in the furnace. 3. Heat for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 1000°C. 2. Place the ceramic crucible with the powdered mixture in the furnace. 3. Heat for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Avoid opening the furnace door during cooling to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Avoid opening the furnace door during cooling to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to smooth out any rough areas and ensure uniformity. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin to enhance durability and finish.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to smooth out any rough areas and ensure uniformity. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin to enhance durability and finish.
